- Task management chat bot to track your tasks
- ALL tasks are auto saved locally in your computer!
- You can find the source code [here](https://github.com/slidings/ip)
1) Types of tasks to be tracked includes ToDos, Deadlines, Events
2) Includes basic functionalities to manage the tasks
ToDos are essentially tasks without any date/time attached to it
Deadlines are tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time
Events are tasks that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time
This lists all the tasks that are added to pebble
This marks a specific task as "done", indicated by the [X]
This unmarks a specific task, and is indicated by an empty box [ ]
>Note: Marking a marked task and unmarking an unmarked task will not do anything
This allows user to filter the list of task by a keyword
This bids goodbye to pebble and will exit the program
Improved support for friendlier command syntax and shortcuts
> Note that all commands outside the ones stated will not be recognised.
[T][ ] check where is this file location

* Tests the Deadline class with valid date format
* Tests the Deadline class with invalid date format
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Submit assignment", "10th September");
* Tests the Deadline class with empty date
* Tests the Deadline class with null date
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Submit assignment", null);
* Tests the Deadline class with extra spaces in date
* Tests the Deadline class with valid date pattern
* Tests the Deadline class with extra spaces in description
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("  Complete the report  ", "2024-08-31");
assertEquals("[D][ ]   Complete the report   (by: Aug 31 2024)", deadline.toString());
* Tests the Deadline class with non date string
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Attend meeting", "end of next week");
assertEquals("[D][ ] Attend meeting (by: end of next week)", deadline.toString());
* Tests the Event class with valid format date range.
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: Sep 10 2024 to: Sep 12 2024)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with invalid format from date.
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: 10th September to: Sep 12 2024)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with invalid format to date.
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: Sep 10 2024 to: 12th September)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with both invalid format dates.
Event event = new Event("Conference", "10th September", "12th September");
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: 10th September to: 12th September)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with empty from date.
* Tests the Event class with empty to date.
* Tests the Event class with null from date.
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: null to: Sep 12 2024)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with null to date.
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: Sep 10 2024 to: null)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with extra spaces in date.
assertEquals("[E][ ] Conference (from: Sep 10 2024 to: Sep 12 2024)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with extra spaces in description.
assertEquals("[E][ ]   Conference   (from: Sep 10 2024 to: Sep 12 2024)", event.toString());
* Tests the Event class with non-date strings.
Event event = new Event("Meeting", "early next week", "end of the month");
assertEquals("[E][ ] Meeting (from: early next week to: end of the month)", event.toString());
